description: five nude boys (four seated, one standing) on rocks in the water; one boy points and standing boy appears to be yelling; trees on opposite bank; study for Alexander Grinager's painting "Boys Bathing", 47.23 .
inscription:
Inscription and Stamp

on back, in pencil: [Mississippi River / Boys Bathing / \"Models]
markings: on back, stamped: [A. L. EIDEMILLER, / 306 / NICOLLET AVE., / MINNEAPOLIS, MINN.]
text: Grinager made this photographic study for Boys Bathing onsite along the banks of the Mississippi River, down by Bohemian Flats (between the current 10th Avenue and Washington Avenue bridges). A stamp on the verso reveals that the image was processed by a photo studio on Nicollet Avenue, just down the street from Grinagerâ€™s painting studio. Undoubtedly, some of the boys who are featured in this photograph eventually appeared in the final Boys Bathing composition.
title: Study for Alexander Grinager's Boys Bathing
